citations.narrative:
The registrant failed to notify USDA APHIS Animal Care within 10 days of a business change (facility address). Failure to
notify the agency of changes that affect the operating status of a carrier impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their
duties. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in the name, address, or
ownership or other change in operations affecting its status as a carrier or intermediate handler, within 10 days after
making such change. Correct by 10/03/2025.

The registrant currently has an intermediate handler “H” registration, however is a carrier and should have a “T”
registration. The registrant was notified on 1/13/2025 that they contain the incorrect registration for their business model.
They explained that they understood and would correct the registration type. At the time of the attempted inspection on
9/15/2025, the registration type has yet to be corrected and the registrant is still conducting regulated activity under the
“H” registration. A registrant that ceases to function as an intermediate handler may cancel by making a written request to
the Deputy Administrator. The former registrant is responsible for reregistering and demonstrating its compliance with the
Act and regulations should it start transporting animal at any time after its registration is canceled. Correct by 10/03/2025.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 1:38PM on
9/15/2025. The inspector contacted the licensee/registrant by cell phone and was notified the facility is no longer at that
address. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.27(a) 
   
Notification of change of operation. 
The registrant failed to notify USDA APHIS Animal Care within 10 days of a business change (facility address). Failure to 
notify the agency of changes that affect the operating status of a carrier impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their 
duties. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in the name, address, or 
ownership or other change in operations affecting its status as a carrier or intermediate handler, within 10 days after 
making such change. Correct by 10/03/2025. 
2.27(b)(2) 
   
Notification of change of operation. 
The registrant currently has an intermediate handler “H” registration, however is a carrier and should have a “T” 
registration. The registrant was notified on 1/13/2025 that they contain the incorrect registration for their business model. 
They explained that they understood and would correct the registration type. At the time of the attempted inspection on 
9/15/2025, the registration type has yet to be corrected and the registrant is still conducting regulated activity under the 
“H” registration. A registrant that ceases to function as an intermediate handler may cancel by making a written request to 
the Deputy Administrator. The former registrant is responsible for reregistering and demonstrating its compliance with the 
Act and regulations should it start transporting animal at any time after its registration is canceled. Correct by 10/03/2025. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 1:38PM on 
9/15/2025. The inspector contacted the licensee/registrant by cell phone and was notified the facility is no longer at that 
address. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and 
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
